info.title: REST API for Oracle Managed File Transfer Cloud Service 12.2.1.2
info.description: Use the REST API for Oracle Managed File Transfer Cloud Service to list services, administer metadata and artifacts, discover and trigger sources, and purge old instance and payload data. To manage SOA Cloud Service servers and services, see the REST API for Oracle SOA Cloud Service.
info.x-summary: Use the REST API for Oracle Managed File Transfer Cloud Service to list services, administer metadata and artifacts, discover and trigger sources, and purge old instance and payload data.

get.description: The response contains the absolute URLs referencing to the Metadata archive and Config file. User artifactName and artifactType parameters to export the transfer and related metadata. To export the artifact from a deployment, provide the label. Use the logFormat flag to get a partial/full details in the config plan file.
get.summary: Get the download links for the MFT MDS archive and Config Plan files

parameters.name: artifactName
parameters.description: Name of the artifact to be exported

parameters.name: artifactType
parameters.description: Type of the artifact to be exported, only support TRANSFER artifactType

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label of the deployment to be exported

parameters.name: longFormat
parameters.description: Option to export the long format having full attribute details in config plan file

application/json.errorMessage: Unsupported artifact type found. Artifact type: <type>

errorCode.description: The error code that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorKey.description: The error key that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorMessage.description: A message describing the error that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

put.description: Supports importing metadata along with optional config plan file which allows to override the attributes in the metadata files.
put.summary: Import the MFT metadata into the MFT MDS store

parameters.name: previewModeFlag
parameters.description: Flag to view the preview the import without actually importing metadata.

application/json.errorMessage: Error occurred while importing the metadata.

errorCode.description: The error code that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorMessage.description: A message that describes the error that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns

get.description: Gets the list of sources active in MFT based on the criteria like application type, binding type, etc. The response contains the list of sources with URLs.

parameters.name: searchFilter
parameters.description: Full/partial Name of source(s) to be discovered

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: Type of the application binding you want to discover

parameters.name: bindingType
parameters.description: Binding type of source you want to discover

parameters.name: onlyEventEnabled
parameters.description: Discover only event enabled sources

eventInvokeUrl.description: URL at which to invoke the event.

errorCode.description: The error code that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorKey.description: The error key that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorMessage.description: A message describing the error that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

post.description: Triggers the file transfer from the specified source, submitting the file to MFT for processing. Responds with a unique id called "eventSessionid" which is used to track the event status and to get the resulting instance details.

parameters.name: sourceName
parameters.description: Name of the source to be triggered.

sourceName.description: Name of the source to be triggered.

properties.title: properties
properties.description: Properties passed with the source name.

entry.description: Each entry is a key value pair of 'string'.
entry.title: entry

200.description: Response returned when source is successfully triggered.

eventSessionId.description: The ID of the event created.

errorCode.description: The error code that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorKey.description: The error key that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorMessage.description: A message describing the error that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

get.description: Gets the event status and instances count for various statuses. Requires submitting an eventSessionId as a path parameter.
get.summary: Get the instances summary of an event

parameters.name: eventSessionId
parameters.description: ID of the event session,

status.description: String value depicting status of the instance.

comments.description: String value describing success or failure reason of the event.

errorCode.description: The error code that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorKey.description: The error key that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorMessage.description: A message describing the error that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

get.description: Retrieves details about the instances created by an event. Requires submitting an eventSessionId as a path parameter. Submit with query parameter inDetail=true for response to contain complete details of the resultant instances; submit without query parameter for response to contain minimal details.
get.summary: Get the details of the resultant instances of an event

parameters.name: inDetail
parameters.description: Return complete details of the resultant instances of an event.

parameters.name: eventSessionId
parameters.description: ID of the event session,

eventSessionId.description: Session ID of the event being queried.

totalInstances.description: Total number of instances created out of this event.

sourceType.description: Depicts the source types for which the event was executed (File, FTP, SFTP, etc.).

status.title: status
status.description: String values depicting status of the instance.
Final status of the instance (Active, Completed, or Failed).

subStatus.description: Substatus of the instance (Pending, Scheduled, Error, etc.).

statusDetail.description: Consolidated detail about the statuses of the instances related to a particular source.

receivedTime.description: Time at which the file was picked up from the source.

priority.description: Priority at which file is processed (High, Medium, or Low).

status.description: Overall status of the target message process (Active, Completed, or Failed).

deliveryStatus.description: Delivery status of the target message (pending, in progress, paused, etc.).

errorCode.description: The error code that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorKey.description: The error key that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.

errorMessage.description: A message describing the error that Oracle Managed File Transfer returns.
